question.text:
Match the catalysts to the correct process.
 
  Catalyst   Process
A. TiCl3 i. Wacker process
B. PdCl2 ii. Ziegler – Natta polymerisation
C. CuCl2 iii. Contact process`
D. V2O5 iv. Deacon’s process

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

solution.text:
The Wacker process is originally referred to the oxidation of ethylene to acetaldehyde by oxygen in water, where the catalyst is tetrachloropalladate(II).

In the contact process, Platinum used to be the catalyst for this reaction, however, as it is susceptible to react with arsenic impurities in the sulphur feedstock, the preferred catalyst today is vanadium (V) oxide (V2O5).

In the Deacon's process, the reaction takes place at about 400 to 450oC in the presence of a variety of catalysts, which include copper chloride (CuCl2).

In Ziegler-Natta polymerisation, homogenous catalysts, usually based on complexes of Ti, Zr or Hf, are used. They are usually used in combination with different catalysts.
